qas.question: Is the cup engraved for the winner?

answers.text: The name of the winning team is engraved on the silver band around the base

qas.question: When does the engraving take place?

answers.text: as soon as the final has finished, in order to be ready in time for the presentation ceremony.

qas.question: how long does the engraved have from start to finish?

answers.text: the engraver has just five minutes to perform a task which would take twenty under normal conditions,
the trophy wears is decorated with ribbons in the colours of both finalists, with the loser's ribbons being removed at the end of the game.

qas.question: Where is he cup presentation made?

answers.text: , the presentation is made at the Royal Box

plausible_answers.text: on the silver band around the base

qas.question: Where is the name of the losing team engraved?
How many minutes does the engraver have to perform a task that would take five minutes under normal conditions?

plausible_answers.text: at the end of the game

qas.question: When are the winner's ribbons removed?
Where is the cup presentation never made?
What is behind the Royal Box?

context: <a0_0>The name of the winning team is engraved <b5_0>on the silver band around the base<b5_0/><a0_0/> <a1_0>as soon as the final has finished, in order to be ready in time for the presentation ceremony.<a1_0/> This means <a2_0>the engraver has just five minutes to perform a task which would take <b6_0>twenty<b6_0/> under normal conditions,<a2_0/> although time is saved by engraving the year on during the match, and sketching the presumed winner. During the final, <a3_0>the trophy wears is decorated with ribbons in the colours of both finalists, with the loser's ribbons being removed <b7_0>at the end of the game<b7_0/>.<a3_0/> Traditionally, at Wembley finals<a4_0>, the presentation is made at <b8_0>the Royal Box<b8_0/><a4_0/>, with players, led by the captain, mounting a staircase to <b9_0>a gangway<b9_0/> in front of the box and returning by a second staircase on the other side of the box. At Cardiff the presentation was made on a podium on the pitch.
